newsitem.title: BELGIUM: LUXEMBOURG CLT'S FIRST-HALF 1996 PROFIT FALLS.
newsitem.headline: LUXEMBOURG CLT'S FIRST-HALF 1996 PROFIT FALLS.

text.p: Luxembourg broadcaster Compagnie Luxembourgeoise de Telediffusion SA's (CLT) first-half 1996 profit fell to 2.2 billion francs from 2.4 billion in the first half of 1995, its parent company, Belgian holding company Groupe Bruxelles Lambert SA (GBL) , said on Wednesday.
GBL has a 22 percent transitive stake in CLT, held via intermediate Luxembourg holding company Audiofina .
GBL said in a statement CLT's first-half consolidated profit included 4.7 billion Luxembourg francs of exceptional capital gains on the sale of its 60 percent stake in its Tele Star unit.
GBL also confirmed that CLT had stopped its Club RTL project for digital television in Germany and that CLT will now focus on its traditional activities in free television.
Charges related to abandonning the digital TV project amounted to 3.6 billion Luxembourg francs, GBL said, confirming earlier media reports.
